intro: Tragia angustifolia var. hastata, commonly known as the narrowleaf tragia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often as an annual herb. Its flowers are usually clustered in dense inflorescences, and the plant produces small, capsule-like fruits. Tragia angustifolia var. hastata is known for its adaptability to harsh conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
